hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is

24th 2018 and the title of the episode
is did Trump just lay out the plan to

we watch the economy slide to the

apart I mean we've been talking about
homes autos which we're gonna be talking
about in just a minute
one thing that is completely constant in
all of this is that Trump is out there
and he continually criticizes the Fed
and what we are watching right now is
Trump setting up the narrative to bring
down the Federal Reserve to bring it to
its knees
to set up a way to audit it to expose it
to the people of America to expose it to
the people of the world in what the
central bank does remember the plan is
not to just go after the deep state it's
to go after the source of their funding
to go after the source of what made the
deep State and what made the deep state
it was easy money
it was the Fed printing money out of
thin air and the government borrowing
and it wasn't tied to checks and
balances
they were just able to do whatever they
wanted with this currency and as we
watched the entire economic system
deteriorate well it looks like Trump is
gonna continually point the finger at
the Fed and as we watch the economy
slide into a recession a depression
Trump is gonna continually come out more
so than ever before to contradict and
actually tell you what the Fed is doing
and why the economy is falling apart now
when we look at the economy we can see
that October auto sales
they have tumbled I mean dealerships
around the country are saying that car
sales are
down 12% traffic is drying up now a
couple reports ago we talked about how
they're changing the credit scores I
wonder if this is why because they
realize as the system breaks down those
people with bank credit they need better
credit so they can take on more debt or
they need better credit to get a
automobile and it looks like this is
exactly what is happening here new home
sales this is completely falling apart
right in front of our eyes new home
sales right now in September they
plunged to their lowest since December
2016 crashing by five point five percent
month a month we're also seeing a 13.2%
collapse from last year this is the
biggest drop since May 2011 and we know
what happened in 2009-2010 we went fully
into the Great Recession we're also
starting to see sale prices they have
declined three and a half percent from a
year ago
this is a complete and utter disaster we
know why it's happening we discussed
this many times as the Fed raises its
rates it's going to affect the housing
industry and things are going to fall
apart and this is going to affect other

name it concrete it's going to affect

is happening the supply of homes is
rising right now so that whole argument
that oh there's no houses on the market
this is why people aren't buying well
this is falling by the wayside now
because if we go back a couple of months
we had about six and a half months of
supply now we have 7.1 months and it's
rising very very quickly something is
wrong
the housing market is falling apart and
it's happening very fast actually if we
look in the northeast section of the
country we saw a decline in purchases
around 40 point 6
percent I mean really think about what
is happening here and we've been
watching and following the housing
market for a very long time and it is
completely falling apart it was falling
apart before but now since the Fed is
raising rates its accelerating now if we
go back in time I want to talk about
what we saw prior to other recessions
and show everyone that it's very
difficult to look at statistical numbers
and try to make heads or tails if we're
heading into a recession this is why we
have to go past this and look at what's
really going on at the peoples level so
let's go back in time stock prices hit
an all-time high in October of 2007 the
latest GDP data showed we hit 4 percent
in the second quarter equally strong
third quarter in GDP growth so we hit 4
percent in second quarter around 4
percent in third quarter and we can see
that everything was fine in 2007
remember this was right on the verge of
the Great Recession which began in
December of 2007 but the thing is they
didn't tell us this is when it began
they told us that everything was fine in
June of 2008 Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke
declared that the risk of a substantial
downturn appears to have diminished
stressing the upside risks to inflation
instead the futures market agreed
wholeheartedly betting on more than a
full percentage point of Fed rate hikes
by year n this was smack in the middle
of what turned out to be the worst

when he said this in 2008 we were
already in the recession because it
started in 2007 and he was telling us
there were no problems when Lehman
Brothers collapsed in August 2008 the
GDP data showed it rising in every

moving up
what this tells us is that even though

statistical numbers are the illusion
that people think that the economy's

everyone thought everything was great

but then we go back in time well they
said the recession actually started in

what's happening now is the same thing

even though Trump is putting it out

more in

State and you get rid of those players
you know other people are gonna take

there's many moving parts to this plan

this is why we've been saying you need
